{"step_by_step_thinking": "The newborn presents with congestive heart failure, which indicates a cardiovascular issue. The bulging anterior fontanelle and bruit on auscultation suggest a vascular anomaly in the brain. The transfontanellar USG showing a hypoechoic midline mass with dilated lateral ventricles further supports this. Medulloblastoma and arachnoid cyst are primarily neoplastic or cystic conditions and would not typically present with these symptoms. Encephalocele is a neural tube defect that would not typically cause congestive heart failure. Vein of Galen malformation is a rare vascular malformation in the brain that can cause high-output heart failure in neonates, which matches the presented symptoms.", "answer_choice": "C. Vein of Galen malformation"}
